parameters.definition: Minimum gallons of chocolate ice cream required to be made in a week
Maximum gallons of chocolate ice cream allowed to be made in a week
Minimum gallons of vanilla ice cream required to be made in a week
Maximum gallons of vanilla ice cream allowed to be made in a week
Time required to produce one gallon of chocolate ice cream
Time required to produce one gallon of vanilla ice cream
Total available time to make ice cream in a week
Profit per gallon of chocolate ice cream
Profit per gallon of vanilla ice cream
Number of workers working on chocolate ice cream
Number of workers working on vanilla ice cream

description: An ice cream store makes chocolate and vanilla ice cream by the gallon. In a week, they must make at least \param{MinChoc} gallons of chocolate ice cream and at least \param{MinVanilla} gallons of vanilla ice cream but at most \param{MaxChoc} gallons of chocolate ice cream and at most \param{MaxVanilla} gallons of vanilla ice cream. It takes \param{TimeChoc} hour to produce a gallon of chocolate ice cream and \param{TimeVanilla} hours to produce a gallon of vanilla ice cream. In a week, \param{TotalTime} hours are available to make ice cream. In addition, at least \param{MinWorkers} workers are needed with \param{WorkersChoc} working on the chocolate ice cream and \param{WorkersVanilla} on the vanilla ice cream at any time. If the profit per gallon of chocolate ice cream is $\param{ProfitChoc} and the profit per gallon of vanilla ice cream is $\param{ProfitVanilla}, how many gallons of each should be made to maximize profit?
